result.execSummary:
The defendant Marissah L. Bozovsky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court
Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay $300.00 fine plus costs. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marissah L. Bozovsky

records.addlTxt:
8:47 AM Defendant Marissah L. Bozovsky in court.  Attorney Carol E Unger in court for Marissah L. Bozovsky.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties have reached an agreement.
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to the sole count.
Court has a colloquy with defendant.
State is in compliance with victim's right and there is no victim present.
Deportation warning given.
Attorney Unger-Keizer believes plea to be made freely, knowingly, and voluntarily.
Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. 
Attorney TenHaken requests Court adopt agreement.
Attorney Unger-Keizer also requests Court adopt agreement.
Court imposes"

$300 fine plus costs and DNA sample and surcharge.
Thirty (30) days to pay or set up a payment plan.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marissah L. Bozovsky in court.  Attorney Carol E Unger in court for Marissah L. Bozovsky. Deft resides in Illinois and had transportation issues. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:51 AM Case called. Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marissah L. Bozovsky not in court.  Attorney Carol E Unger in court for Marissah L. Bozovsky. 
Atty Unger-Keizer will file an authorization. 
Court excuses the deft appearance. 
Atty Unger-Keizer requests plea/sent in 45 days. 
Plea/sent set for July 15, 2022 @ 8:30am, 2560

9:33 AM Case called. Attorney Leah Selmek in court for Marissah L. Bozovsky.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Authorization on file. 
Atty Selmek asks for another status. 
No victim present. 
Status set for June 3, 2022 @ 8:30am, 2560

Attorney Leah Selmek in court for Marissah L. Bozovsky. Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Waiting for offer. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Marissah L. Bozovsky not in court, Attorney Leah Selmek appeared in court for Marissah L. Bozovsky. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Marissah L. Bozovsky appeared in court. Defendant's mother appeared in court. SPD did not appear, defendant does qualify for SPD attorney. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH NIPPERSINK HOTEL IN BLOOMFIELD, WI.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Marissah L. Bozovsky appeared, Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
